content.description: Whoazzur Arete starts with deceptively tricky moves over a small overhang at the first bolt. On the arete above ascend on thin holds past three bolts. Finish by climbing past two bolts on the upper headwall.
content.protection: Eight bolts to a two-bolt anchor with quicklinks and chains for rappel (all bolts and hangers are SS).
content.location: Whoazzur Arete begins at the lowest point of Mystery Rock.

climbs.name: Show Me Where It Says I Can't Do This
climbs.fa: Tom Pietrykowski and Chad McDonald, Aug. 2021

content.description:
Start in a well featured, lichen crusted moderate hand crack in a left-facing corner 20' right of

Alliteration Arete

. Navigate some maple bushes as the crack turns into a short gully, and find the headwall. The crux is the headwall featuring finger locks and face climbing protected by intermittent cracks. Angle left (protected by small wires and a RP) under the roof to where the line joins the last bolt of

Alliteration Arete

(a #0.4 Camalot can be placed 6" right of that bolt for a pure trad line).

Note: it seems unlikely that this hasn't been climbed yet - given the previous crag development, but we trundled a death-block and left several loose rocks (just right of the route) in the gully to preserve the nature of this climb. It's a bit wooly, and depending on the future traffic, it may require some lichen gardening (minimal) to establish pro.
content.protection: A standard rack up to #3 Camalot, double #0.5 Camalots will sew up the initial hand-crack, lots of small wires, and a RP will protect the crux.
content.location:
This ascends the left-facing dihedral 20' right/uphill of

Alliteration Arete

, shares a 2 bolt anchor with

Alliteration Arete

, and has a very comfortable belay seat/double-tree. Â Also pulling the rope from this location prevents dropping your rope into the very healthy poison ivy patch just under

Alliteration Arete

.

content.description: This is a climb with 20 feet of very good climbing in a crack followed by reasonable climbing for 65 additional feet.  The climb may feel somewhat misnamed.  Although it is characterized by a crack at the bottom, it is only 1/3 of the climb and wider than fingers for half of that, ranging from 0.75" to 2".  After the crack, head up and slightly left passing a short-needled fir to the left side of it, then up and left more to pass a long-needled pine to the right side before cutting more sharply left (maybe slightly run-out, but on very moderate terrain) to head up and left to the bolted anchor with rap hangers at the top of the climb 'Open Book.' The slight run-out up top can be avoided by going left under the pine and finishing via the 2 bolts on the top of "Open Book." Rap 85'.
content.protection: A rack from 0.5-3" and a single bolt, or 3 bolts finishing on the other route.
content.location: This is the obvious and striking finger to thin-hands crack on the uphill right side of the crag, starting from a natural platform at the cliff's base above a short, loose gully.

content.description: Alliteration Arete is an enjoyable route that climbs a lot better than it looks. It is best to lower from the top as the stance at the anchor is poor.
content.protection: Nine bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location:
Alliteration Arete is the next bolted route uphill from

Whoazzur Arete

and begins next to a triple-trunked tree.

pathTokens: South Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
